DOC.brief_summary: The rationale for fetal therapy in severe congenital diaphragmatic hernia (CDH) is to restore adequate lung growth for neonatal survival.
DOC.brief_title: Trial of Fetoscopic Endoluminal Tracheal Occlusion (FETO)
DOC.detailed_description: Prenatal tracheal occlusion (TO) obstructs the normal egress of lung fluid during pulmonary development leading to increased lung tissue stretch, increased cell proliferation, and accelerated lung growth. European colleagues have developed foregut endoscopy and techniques to position and remove endoluminal tracheal balloons in utero. Recently, the Belgium group published summary results of FETO showing an improved survival in 175 patients with isolated left CDH from 24% to 49%. The goal of this pilot study is to study the feasibility of implementing FETO therapy in the most severe group of fetuses with left CDH Observed/expected lung-to-head ratio < 25%(O/E LHR < 25%).
DOC.criteria: Pregnant women age 18 years and older, who are able to consent Singleton pregnancy Fetal Normal Karyotype Fetal Diagnosis of Isolated Left CDH with liver up Gestation at enrollment prior to 29 wks plus 6 days SEVERE pulmonary hypoplasia with Uultra Sound O/E LHR < 25% Pregnant women <18 years of age.
